message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MA, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with scheduling in wireless networks, which is a topic that falls under the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) categories. The use of Markov-modulated channels and the exploration-exploitation trade-off suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) category. The analysis of the Whittle's Index Policy involves mathematical optimization, which could place the paper in the Mathematical Optimization (cs.MA) category. Finally, the paper deals with the performance analysis of a scheduling policy, which could also make it relevant to the Game Theory (cs.GT) category.
